description:
Streptomyces bottropensis ATCC 25435 is a species of actinobacteria, a group of Gram-positive, filamentous bacteria known for their ability to produce a wide range of secondary metabolites. This particular strain was isolated from a soil sample collected in Bottrop, Germany.

Streptomyces bottropensis is a aerobic, spore-forming bacterium that can grow on various media, forming characteristic leathery, wrinkled colonies. It is known to produce a range of bioactive compounds, including the antibiotics bottromycin and streptonigrin, which have been studied for their potential therapeutic applications.

The genome of Streptomyces bottropensis ATCC 25435 has been sequenced, revealing insights into its biosynthetic capabilities and genetic diversity. This information has been valuable for understanding the species' ecology, as well as its potential in the development of novel pharmaceutical and industrial products.
